metadata.title: Apple Watch Complications and Accessory Widgets Design Guidelines
metadata.author: Apple Inc.
metadata.summary: Comprehensive Apple Developer documentation covering watch complications design guidelines, complication families (circular, corner, inline, rectangular), legacy templates, image specifications for all Apple Watch sizes, and guidance for creating accessory widgets that appear on Lock Screen and Apple Watch.

sources.focus: Design guidelines, visual specifications, and best practices for watch complications

sources.fileName: Creating accessory widgets and watch complications | Apple Developer Documentation.pdf
sources.focus: Technical implementation guidance for accessory widgets and WidgetKit complications

complicationFamilies.overview: Starting in watchOS 9, the system organizes complications (also known as accessories) into several families. A watch face can specify the family it supports in each complication slot.

modernFamilies.description: Circular layouts that can include text, gauges, and full-color images in circular areas on watch faces like Infograph and Infograph Modular.

layouts.description: Circular image with a closed ring gauge surrounding it
Text content with a closed ring gauge surrounding it
Circular image with an open-style gauge (arc) surrounding it
Text content with an open-style gauge surrounding it
Gauge showing a range of values with open style
Stacked image layout within circular area
Stacked text layout within circular area

extraLargeSize.description: For X-Large watch face with oversized treatment of important information

imageSizes.note: The system applies a circular mask to each image

bezelText.description: Text that curves along the bezel of watch faces like Infograph

modernFamilies.description: Corner layouts display full-color images, text, and gauges in the corners of watch faces like Infograph.

imageSizes.note: The system applies a circular mask to each image

modernFamilies.description: Inline layouts include utilitarian small and large layouts for text-based complications.

subTypes.description: Rectangular area in the corner of watch faces like Chronograph and Simple
Text-based layout that spans the bottom of watch faces like Utility or Motion. Supports an interface icon on the leading side.

layouts.description: Wide text-based layout with optional leading icon

modernFamilies.description: Rectangular layouts display full-color images, text, a gauge, and optional title in a large rectangular region. Works well for showing details about values or processes that change over time.

smartStackSupport.description: Starting with watchOS 10, rectangular layouts may display in the Smart Stack
optimizations: Supply background color or content that communicates information or aids in recognition
Use intents to specify relevancy for appropriate timing
Create custom layouts optimized for the Smart Stack

layouts.description: Standard text body with optional icon

designGuidance.contrast: Use high-contrast colors for primary content
designGuidance.secondary: Use lower-contrast gray for graph lines and labels
designGuidance.goal: Make data easy to understand at a glance

legacyTemplates.description: Legacy templates define nongraphic complication styles that do not take on a wearer's selected color. Use for watchOS versions before watchOS 9.
legacyTemplates.developerGuidance: Continue to implement the ClockKit complication data source protocol (CLKComplicationDataSource) to support earlier versions of watchOS.

templates.description: Displays a small image or a few characters of text in the corner of watch faces like Color
Displays two stacked rows with icon and content, circular graph, or single larger item. Appears in bottom row of Modular watch face.
Large canvas for displaying up to three rows of content. Appears in the center of Modular watch face.
Displays larger text and images on X-Large watch faces

accessoryWidgets.overview: WidgetKit allows you to extend the reach of your app to the Lock Screen on iPhone and iPad, and to the Smart Stack on Apple Watch as accessory widgets. Accessory widgets also appear as watch complications on Apple Watch.
benefits: Display app's most relevant, glanceable content in highly visible contexts
Let people quickly access your app for more details
Share code between iOS and watchOS apps
Create watch complications and Lock Screen widgets simultaneously
widgetKitAdvantages: Update existing widgets code to support accessory widgets
Offer WidgetKit complications for watchOS app
Share more code between iOS and watchOS apps
Add support for iOS or watchOS in addition to platforms already supported

lockScreenWidgets.description: Accessory widgets appear on the Lock Screen providing glanceable information

smartStackWidgets.description: Rectangular complications can appear in the Smart Stack on Apple Watch

migrationNotes.important: As soon as you offer a widget-based complication, the system stops calling ClockKit APIs. The system may still wake your data source for migration requests.
migrationNotes.recommendation: Plan to migrate existing ClockKit complications to WidgetKit as described in Migrating ClockKit complications to WidgetKit

relatedComponents.name: AccessoryWidgetGroup
relatedComponents.description: A view type that has a label at the top and three content views masked with a circle or rounded square

relatedComponents.name: AccessoryWidgetGroupStyle
relatedComponents.description: The style for an AccessoryWidgetGroup view

contentStrategy.description: Display relevant information that always feels up to date. A static complication that doesn't display meaningful data may be less likely to remain in a prominent position.

contentStrategy.practice: Support all complication families when possible
contentStrategy.description: Supporting more families means complications are available on more watch faces. If you can't display useful information, provide an image representing your app (like your app icon) that lets people launch your app.

contentStrategy.practice: Create multiple complications for each family
contentStrategy.description: Helps take advantage of shareable watch faces and lets people configure a watch face centered on an app they love.
contentStrategy.example: A triathlon training app could offer three circular complications (swimming, biking, running), each deep-linking to segment-specific areas

contentStrategy.practice: Define different deep links for each complication
contentStrategy.description: Each complication should open your app to the most relevant area. If all complications open the same area, they seem less useful.

privacyConsiderations.alwaysOnDisplay: With Always-On Retina display, information might be visible to people other than the wearer
privacyConsiderations.recommendation: Help people prevent potentially sensitive information from being visible to others

timelineManagement.description: You provide complication data as a timeline where each entry has a value specifying when to display data
limitations: Limited number of timeline updates per day
System stores limited number of timeline entries per app

examples.behavior: Display upcoming meeting information an hour before the meeting starts
Display forecast information at the time those conditions are expected to occur

timelineManagement.developerReference: See Migrating ClockKit complications to WidgetKit

gaugeStyles.description: Choose ring or gauge style based on the data you need to display

styles.name: Closed
styles.useCase: Values that are a percentage of a whole

styles.name: Open
styles.useCase: When minimum and maximum values are arbitrary or don't represent a percentage

styles.name: Segmented
styles.useCase: Values within app-defined range that can convey rapid value changes

tintedModeDesign.description: In tinted mode, the system applies a solid color to text, gauges, and images, and desaturates full-color images
guidelines: Avoid using color as the only way to communicate important information
When necessary, provide an alternative tinted-mode version of full-color images
Recognize that people might prefer tinted mode for complications
tintedModeDesign.legacyNote: For legacy templates, tinted mode applies only to graphic complications

lineWidth.recommendation: Generally use line widths of two points or greater
lineWidth.reason: Thinner lines can be difficult to see at a glance, especially when wearer is in motion
lineWidth.guidance: Use line weights that suit the size and complexity of the image

placeholderImages.purpose: Displayed when there's no other content to display
useCases: When people first install your app (while system checks for localized placeholder)
In the carousel from which people select complications
placeholderImages.note: Placeholder image sizes may not match the size of actual images for that complication

newAppDevelopment.title: Create a new app that offers widgets and watch complications
newAppDevelopment.recommendation: Support iOS and watchOS and offer widgets and complications right from the start to create shared code base and reduce costly code changes later
steps: Open Xcode and create a new project
Choose watchOS app template and select Watch App with New Companion iOS App
Add a new watchOS widget extension target to your project
Add a new iOS widget extension target to your project
Add code for iOS and watchOS apps, create iOS widgets (including Lock Screen) and watchOS complications using SwiftUI views and WidgetKit

existingIOSApp.title: Add accessory widgets to existing iOS App
existingIOSApp.guidance: Adding accessory widgets works like supporting any other widget size
existingIOSApp.ifNoWidgets: Add a widget extension to your app and support accessory widgets from the start
existingIOSApp.additionalConsideration: Consider adding support for watchOS with WidgetKit complications by adding a watchOS app target and watchOS widget extension target

existingWatchOSApp.title: Add WidgetKit complications to existing watchOS app
existingWatchOSApp.ifNoComplications: Add a watchOS widget extension to your project in Xcode and create complications with WidgetKit

ifHasClockKit.guidance: Continue to use ClockKit to support watchOS 8 and earlier
ifHasClockKit.migration: Plan to migrate existing ClockKit complications to WidgetKit
ifHasClockKit.important: As soon as you offer a widget-based complication, the system stops calling ClockKit APIs

existingWatchOSApp.additionalConsideration: Consider adding iOS support by adding an iOS app target if watchOS app doesn't have iOS companion app

platformSupport.note: Complications are specific to watchOS, but accessory widgets extend to Lock Screen on iOS/iPadOS

appleWatchSizes.note: 45mm and 49mm share the same image specifications in most cases

keyTerms.definition: A display element on the watch face that shows timely, relevant information that people can view each time they raise their wrist
Widget that appears on the Lock Screen on iPhone/iPad and as watch complications on Apple Watch
Apple framework for creating widgets and watch complications using SwiftUI
Legacy framework for creating watch complications, deprecated in favor of WidgetKit
A scrollable stack of widgets on Apple Watch (watchOS 10+) that can display rectangular complications
A display mode where the system applies a solid color to text, gauges, and images based on wearer's selected color
The data structure for providing complication data with time-based entries
A visual element that represents numerical values, available in closed, open, and segmented styles

keyFindings: Prefer using WidgetKit for watchOS 9+ complications; ClockKit is deprecated
Supporting more complication families increases availability across watch faces
Each complication should have a unique deep link to the most relevant app area
Always-On Retina display requires privacy considerations for sensitive information
Line widths should generally be 2 points or greater for visibility
Rectangular complications can appear in Smart Stack starting with watchOS 10
Tinted mode requires alternative image versions if full-color images don't desaturate well
When a widget-based complication is offered, ClockKit APIs stop being called

technicalSpecifications.circularMask: Applied automatically to circular complication images
technicalSpecifications.rectangularCornerRadius: 4 points applied automatically to large images

designDecisions.decision: Use rounded font style with medium or semibold weight for complication text
designDecisions.rationale: Matches Apple's design language and ensures readability at small sizes

designDecisions.decision: Provide placeholder images for each complication
designDecisions.rationale: Ensures good appearance in complication picker and during initial app installation
Enables shareable watch faces and user customization around your app

designDecisions.decision: Use high-contrast colors for primary content in rectangular complications
designDecisions.rationale: Makes data easy to understand at a glance
